properties.name: Andrew Molera State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Andrew Molera State Beach is very popular with nature-lovers. Cautions: Andrew Molera State Beach is a popular stop for nature-loving nudists. Clothing-optional has been discouraged by rangers to the point that few nudists still use it. If you want to go there, stick to the southernmost coves. Clothing-optional has been discouraged by rangers to the point that few nudists still use it. If you want to go there, stick to the southernmost coves. Off CA 1, between Bixby Creek Bridge and the Big Sur campground Well-marked entrance at milepost 51.20 parking on the side of the road The nude area is south of the Big Sur River Wait until low tide and wade south to the nude coves

properties.name: Black's Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Black\'s Beach, America\'s most popular, is still an active nudist site in the state-owned portion. If visit, do your part to keep it that way by respecting the boundary signs and covering up if you\'re going beyond them. Cautions: Nudity bans are enforced on the south end in the city-owned portion of Black\'s Beach (35 fine) Shuffle your feet in the water to avoid stingray injury

properties.name: Bolsa Chica State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Jamd3  huntington beach caBeware the Ides of March.

properties.name: C'est la plage...
properties.description: Posted by SylvainchambC\'est vraiment pas une plage commerciale... Il fait 134 deg F avec l\'humidex, Humidité relative de 94% sa calme les ardeurs... Le weekend il y a un peu plus de monde...

properties.name: Doran Beach County Park
properties.description: Posted by Rich   A fun kid friendly beach. Protected from dangerous sleeper waves.

properties.name: Gaudalupe Dunes Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Description: Mike says: "The only other people I saw were right where the parking lot trail ends on the beach... Very isolated and pristine. After another 1/2 mile I felt comfortable enough to go nude... I observed the many types of birds all without seeing another soul. On a calm, clear day (no wind or fog) this beach would be very close to perfect!"

properties.name: Gaviota Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Gaviota Beach is a solitary beach protected by high cliffs. Getting to Gaviota Beach: North of Santa Barbara on US 101 before the refinery. Park along the road next to the Amtrak tracks, but don\'t leave your valuables in the car. Stay on the paths to avoid poison oak.

properties.name: Gunnison Beach
properties.description: Posted by Nakednudism  Nude Beach at Sandy Hook, NJ

properties.name: Hearst Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Location: Near Hearst Castle Sponsored Links Hearst Castle VacationBeautiful ocean front, ocean view, & forest view vacation homes.cambriavacationrentals.com The Burton InnLuxurious Boutique Hotel, two room suites with B&B amenities.www.burtoninn.com Twin Dolphin in Morro Bay3 diamond AAA Oceanview Rooms A/C\'s, Balconies, Internet Specialswww.thetwindolphin.com Description: Pretty small cove Who\'s at Hearst Beach: Mostly locals

properties.name: Ibiza / Eivissa
properties.description: Posted by Engbothe perfect island / place to live / to go on holidays

properties.name: La plage de Myrtel Beach
properties.description: Posted by Sylvainchamb  C\'est pas la même jungle qu\'à Nags Head. Beaucoup de Québécois, beaucoup de familles. L\'eau est chaude...

properties.name: More Mesa Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  34.41639, -119.8075More Mesa Beach is a very friendly and popular beach. Who\'s at More Mesa Beach: Friendly crowd, very social. Up to 100 visitors on a busy day More Mesa Beach Activities: Volleyball, jogging, sunbathing, Frisbee, swimming, bodysurfing, surfing Getting to More Mesa Beach: * US 101 north of Santa Barbara * Between Hope Beach and UCSB * Turnpike Road exit south (toward the ocean) * Left on Hollister Avenue * Right on Puente Drive (becomes Vieja Drive) 3/4 mile * Look for parking when you see Mockingbird Lane * Mockingbird is a restricted street and you will be towed, park on Vieja * Wear shoes for the long walk (about a mile) * Walk uphill on Mockingbird until it terminates. * There is a barricade on the left with private property warnings but use the gap for pedestrians and continue to the stairs that start near the Eucalyptus grove. * The path is steep but easy * The nude area is to the right. See the comments above from Brad and stay north of the trail to prevent future law enforcement hassles.

properties.name: Nikki Beach
properties.description: Posted by Philip   St. BarthA beachside restaurant on St. Barth

properties.name: Ninety Mile Beach
properties.description: Posted by Kclama  More of my photos in New Zealand.

properties.name: North Marina Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Near Castroville, CANorth Marina is a nice beach long used by local residents. Description: A sunbathing area in the sand dunes. Can be foggy and cold in summer (yes, summer!) Who\'s at North Marina Beach: Mostly local residents North Marina Beach Facilities: Restrooms on the road leading into the hang gliding center parking lot North Marina Beach Activities: Swimming not recommended. Waves are very hazardous Driving: Just south of Castroville on CA 1. Exit at Reservation Road and turn west off exit ramp (toward the water). Turn right onto Dunes Drive, past the Marina Dunes Resort Parking: Park along the road or in the small parking area. If Dunes Drive is parked full, go back and park at the parking lot near the hang gliding center Walking: From Dunes Drive, follow the path from the yellow vehicle gate across the dunes

properties.name: Panther Beach and Hole-in-the-Wall
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Just a little about 10 miles north of Santa Cruz, Panther Beach is a local secret and is a spectacular place to enjoy a picnic lunch, or the beauty of the pacific or climb a boulder or two. This beach area is gorgeous! There is a large boulderable arch, and many beachside climbing sections at this little oasis. In the middle of the Beachside Wall there is a cave extending 10 feet into the rock. At the left side of entrance, there are a few good hands within reach above the overhang of the cave. The landings are in the sand, so it makes it fairly safe for dropping. Without questions, Panther Beach is known for rock climbing and the difficulties in climb ranges from very easy to more advanced climbs, putting you over 25 feet in the air. Because a lot of the rock is sandstone, climbing should however be done with caution. The high tide also will affect some of the routes. DIRECTIONS: CA Hiway1 just south of Davenport between milepost 26.86 and 26.4. The entrance is very hard to see when coming from the north. Look for a dirt road between the west side of highway and the railroad track and be prepared to make a very sharp turn. Parking: Park on the dirt between the highway and the railroad tracks (west of the highway) Take special care with your belongings, as vandalism has been reported there. Walking: From the north end of the parking area, cross the tracks and follow the trail. It is steep and eroded, use with caution and watch for poison oak. The only way to get to Hole in the Wall is to walk through the hole in the rocks at the south end of the beach, but do not try it at high tide and be sure to get back before the tide comes in. NOTE: Directly next to Panther Beach is Hole in the Wall, which is considered a nude beach. ACTIVITIES: An incredible beach for nature sight seeing, bird watching, rock climbing, sun bathing, or just enjoying a picnic lunch.

properties.name: Pirate's Cove
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname Description: * Quarter mile long cove * One of the most beautiful nude beach settings * No fishermen here, so it\'s easy to walk without fear of getting "caught." Who\'s at Pirate\'s Cove: * Up to 200 on weekends * Suited and not * Almost half are women * 10 percent families * Gawkers on the cliff and on the beach Pirate\'s Cove Facilities: None About 7 miles south of San Luis Obispo and 5 miles north of Pismo Beach off US 101. Take the Avila Beach exit Follow the signs toward Avila Beach for 2.0 miles As soon as the golf course is visible, look for a road to the left going uphill Turn left on Cave Landing Rd Follow the road to a dirt parking lot at the end Pirate\'s Cove in Avila Bay should not be confused with Pirate\'s Cove in Los Angeles. This beach is also called Cave Landing or Mallagh Landing. Take the trail at the south (left) end of the lot Stay to the left go down the long series of steps At the sand, walk east to the far end of the beach The nude area is near the volleyball net

properties.name: Red White and Blue beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   North of Santa Cruz, CAThis is a naturist camping resort and beach. Fees apply. Hot showers, flush toilets. Camper, RV and tent spaces.

properties.name: Rincon beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Rincon Beach has nice views and clean sand, but is flat and open to view. This beach has been used by naturists but it is not an official naturist beach and you can be fined or arrested. Description: Nice ocean views, and a seal sanctuary. Clean sand, 200-foot-high cliffs Rincon Beach Activities: Surfing, tide pooling, volleyball Getting to Rincon Beach: Highway 101, 10 miles south of Santa Barbara. Exit at Bates Road in Carpinteria and follow the signs to the beach.

properties.name: Salt Creek Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  33333 S. Pacific Coast Hwy., Dana Point, CA 92629 Salt Creek Park Provides South County residents access to 18 acres of public beaches. The park consists of landscaped parking facility, sandy beaches, rocky promontories, and sheer cliffs. The original ravine canyon locally known as Salt Creek, makes the northerly boundary of the beach. Grading and landscaping have been completed in such a manner as to blend with the natural features, leaving the beach and cliff area basically undisturbed.

properties.name: San Clemente State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  33.40396,-117.6024 San Clemente State Beach is popular with surfers on the north end of the one-mile beach. Other popular activities are skin diving and hiking along the trails on the bluffs. The beach has a landscaped bluff top with picnic areas. Trails lead down to the beach, which is also popular for body surfing, swimming, and skin diving.

properties.name: San Onofre Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  San Onofre Beach is a popular beach is located just south of Camp Pendleton. Beware of helicopters overhead if you\'re sensitive about being seen. I-5 exit at Basilone Road Follow Basilone to the state park (NOT the state beach) The entrance is 0.5 miles south of the entrance to the nuclear plant. Inside the park, follow the road 3.0 miles to the end of the parking lot. Look for either of the two signs for Beach Trail #6 Parking lot, fee charged Fills up by 9 AM on hot days, but you may be able to get around this by paying for an overnight camping spot Or, drive to Las Pulgas Road, park there and bicycle in Walk down steep path #6 to the sand, then another 20 minutes to south along the shore, past the lifeguard station and past the gully

properties.name: Scott's Creek Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  37.0408, -122.2281Scott Creek Beach is an easily accessible nude beach near a busy family beach area. Description: One half mile long beach at the bottom of a small bluff. At the north end there is a a great surfing spot. Who\'s at Scott Creek Beach: Surfers (Oct - May), suited sunbathers, skinny-dippers. Lots of families (clothed) in the area near the road Driving: North of Davenport on CA 1between mileposts 31.8 and 31.29 This beach is very easy to find, it\'s one of the few places where the road is at ocean level and the beach comes right up to the road. Telephone call box SZ-001-318 is just north of the beach. Parking: Two turnouts for parking Be careful not to get stuck in the sand. Park with your drive wheels toward the pavement. Walking: Descend north or south of the bridge It\'s easy to get onto the beach from the road, but walking north across Scott Creek can be hazardous when the creek is flowing strongly The nude area is at the bottom of the cliff

properties.name: Shore Club
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor 1901 Collins Avenue, Miami, FLFancy Schmancy South Beach Style

properties.name: Stinson Beach!
properties.description: Posted by Birgit  Rockin\' beach to take the dog off leash. Follow the signs off Highway 1. From the parking lot, go to the northern most beach access and head north on the beach (south of this entrance is all state park land: no dogs allowed). From here, let the mutt off leash to romp and roll in the dead seal carcasses - this being great white territory, there are some - all the way up to the ... inlet? Is that what those are called? Basically, at the end of the beach you can see Bolinas, one of the most guarded or secretive towns on the coast. Beware of strong outgoing tides, and rip currents: low tide is a great time to go, high tide can be dangerous for water dogs. Stinsonites are very friendly, as are their dogs. I\'ve found the best time of day is very early morning right before you head up or down the coast for one of the most beautiful scenic drives around.

properties.name: Sunset Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Sunset Beach, CASunset Beach is an unincorporated community in north Orange County, California. Located on the Pacific Ocean, many houses reside on sand beaches, with hotels, restaurants and shops situated along Pacific Coast Highway, the primary road passing through this one mile stretch between Huntington Beach and the unincorporated town, Surfside. Beach Location: West of Pacific Ave between Anderson St and Warner Ave, Huntington Beach CA Parking: Limited free street parking. Hours: 6 am to 10 pm. Attractions: Bike paths, surfing, volleyball Facilities: Lifeguards and rest rooms. Contact: For beach information, contact the Orange County Harbors, Beaches, and Parks at (714) 834-2400.

properties.name: Zmudowski State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  North of Moss Landing, CAA nice beach, but this is mostly a clothed family beach. Suit up if you see a ranger approaching. Zmudowski Beach is nice, but this is mostly a clothed family beach that only gets occasional nude use. The former nude beach here known as Hidden Beach is now a clothed beach. Description: Soft sand and warm Who\'s at Zmudowski Beach: A few hundred visitors on a hot day, but the beach is big and doesn\'t seem crowded Zmudowski Beach Facilities: Portable toilets in parking lot Driving: Just north of Moss Landing on CA 1, just south of mile 98.0 Follow the signs toward Zmudowski State Beach Turn onto Struve Road and go 0.2 miles to its intersection with Giberson Road (left) Follow Giberson as it zigzags 2.0 miles to its end, at the state beach parking lot Parking: Free parking lot Walking: Hike to the north end of the beach via the dirt access road that starts at the small lot Clothing-optional bathers usually gather behind the dunes

properties.name: Zuma Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  30000 Pacific Coast Highway, Malibu, CAZuma Beach is where native Angelenos go when they want to get away from crowds and dirty water. The sweeping landscape, crystal-clear water and great waves draw locals from all over, including hard-core surfers and families on a weekend outing.

properties.name: clothing optional beach
properties.description: Posted by Jason

properties.name: garrapata beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Near Carmel, CAGarrapata Beach is a nice beach noted for its scenic beauty. Rangers have been given discretion to cite nudists if anyone complains, and with a lot of families here on weekends, the likelihood of complaints is increased. * A mile of clean sand, lagoon, coves, caves * Wildflowers in spring and early summer * The central part of the beach can be cooler than the ends because of the wind Who\'s at Garrapata Beach: Clothed and unclothed. Singles, families, locals, tourists, gays, and straights Garrapata Beach Facilities: None Garrapata Beach Activities: Swimming not recommended. Waves are very hazardous Driving: South of Carmel on CA 1 near milepost 63.1, shortly past the Garrapata State Beach sign, 9.6 miles south of the Rio Road traffic light in Carmel. The house below is just beyond the parking area Parking: Large parking area along the highway Walking: The obvious trail leads to the middle of the beach. Near the beach, it forks. The left trail goes down to the middle of the beach and the right one follows the edge of the cliffs, eventually descending to a creek and the beach. This path could be dangerous when the creek is flowing strongly. The nude area is on the far north end of the beach

properties.name: public beach
properties.description: Posted by Ugly  our original destination. we never made it.

properties.name: summerland Beach
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Summerland beach is south of Santa Barbara, with sandy coves. Getting to Summerland Beach: 6 miles south of Santa Barbara on US 101. Exit at Evans and turn left under the freeway. Take the next left and drive 0.3 mile. At the recycling center sign, turn right just before the freeway into a long parking lot. Go down the ramp to the beach, then walk south to the nude area, which starts below the only house on the bluffs
